title: How is history taught in China - what are the key topics covered? - Quora

response.answer_text: Both Fem Zeng and Taizhi Lu are correct, But,things are changing.... I'm in the second year of high school...we are preparing for Gao kao,and our teacher told us that we have to mix those three books up because according to the new curriculum standard,our history books will be written in  Marx's historic materialism order. And I don't know if this is good or bad. (Welcome to correct my mistakes,especially grammar mistakes,thanks a lot.)

Ignore Li Xinran's answer. I'll take High School as an example. High School has 3 mandatory textbooks for HY: 1)Popitical 2)Economical 3) Cultural General history is taught in middle shcool. Thus we will focus on the political system like central/local division/relation, bureaucracy system, supervising system. Economic factors base on productivity like Rural industry/agriculture/trade and business with the relationships between individuals and the government. …… ……

As we all know,China has a very strict educational system,which means exams are always put in the first place.As a result of this,schools and teachers have to teach something most related to exams,so they give their opnions and judgements on certain history topics and what students have to do is memorizing them and use them in exams.Another important reason for this kind of teaching method is because of the politics reasons.And about topics,they usually teach history about ancient China,important revolutions,contemporary history.In a word,a long time span of history.

It's supper boring and makes me want to kill myself. It's all about to get a high score so you can go to a good university. I hated history when I was in school. Now I love history very much because there are so much interesting things and knowledge in it. But the Chinese school history teaching manage to change the one of the most interesting thing into the most boring one. You can't have your own idea, you just memorise it and write it down in the exam paper. Even when the exam paper askes "what do you think about......." It's not asking your idea, it's actually asking "what does the book say about....." Errrr, so happy I can learn history in my own way now.

The failure of every feudalism dynasties are predestined,because they only representative minority civilians' interest; The success of CPC is predestined,because it  representative multiple civilians' interest.
